abstract: AMR Corporation says its third-quarter fuel costs rose 40 percent from a year ago, and a September spike in the value of the dollar eroded overseas sales; shares of company fall 7.5 percent to $2.61 as it reports a third-quarter net loss of $162 million, or 48 cents a share, compared with a profit of $143 million, or 39 cents a share a year earlier; revenue was $6.4 billion.
snippet: American Airlines, a unit of AMR, blamed rising fuel costs and a strong dollar for its losses.
lead_paragraph: American Airlines, a unit of AMR, blamed rising fuel costs and a strong dollar for its losses.

headline.main: Fuel Costs Contribute to Wider Loss at AMR
headline.print_headline: Fuel Costs Contribute To Wider Loss At AMR
headline.seo: AMR Shares Suffer in Wake of Wider Loss
